publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Oswego

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by Zachary Vickery.

did.abstract: Papers relating the years Dr. Charles S. Turner was affiliated with Oswego State College. Dr. Turner was college dean, acting college president, director of education and department chairman. Papers include correspondence, newspaper clippings, photographs and memorandums.

repository.corpname: State University of New York at Oswego

bioghist.p: Dr. Charles S. Turner was born in Centralia, Missouri. Dr. Turner graduated from Northeastern Missouri State Teachers College and earned a master's degree in 1936 and a doctorate in 1940. He was associate head of the SUCO Department of Education in 1941 and was department chairman from 1948 - 1954. He was SUCO director of education from 1954 - 1963. In 1960 he was appointed dean of the college. From 1963 - 1965 Dr. Turner was interim president of the college.

In 1968 Dr. Turner worked with Dr. Halas Jackim and Dr. Harold Keeler in an assignment Brazil with the State University team under a contract with the U.S. Agency for International Development to provide a program of technical assistance to Brazilian primary education.

Dr. Turner was Immediate Past President of the Central Zone of the New York State Teachers association, member of the New York State Council for Administrative Leadership and the New York State Education Department's Committee of Eleven. He was a member of the following professional honor societies: Blue Key, Kappa Delta Pi and Phi Delta Kappa. He served on the Board of Trustees of the Oswego County Savings Bank.
Dr. Turner was married to Evelyn Shoemaker and they had a son, Charles, and a daughter, Nancy. He retired from the college in May 1970 after 29 years as teacher and administrator.
Dr. Charles S. Turner passed away in June 1984. He resided in Oswego, NY.

scopecontent.p: Papers relating the years Dr. Charles S. Turner was affiliated with Oswego State College. Dr. Turner was college dean, acting college president, director of education and department chairman. Papers include correspondence, newspaper clippings, photographs and memorandums.

userestrict.p: Please contact SUNY Oswego Archives and Special Collections for use restrictions.

scopecontent.p:
17 typed cover letters (carbon copies) for Annual Report from acting SUNY Oswego president, Charles S. Turner. Recipients include: Charles H. Foster, University Controller, SUNY John C. Crary, Jr., Counsel, SUNY Ruth V. Files, Associate Counsel, SUNY J. Lawrence Murray, Executive Vice President, SUNY Dr. Harry Porter, Provost, SUNY Dr. David S. Price, Assistant Vice President, SUNY Dr. John H. Slocum, Vice President for Administration, SUNY Elwin Stevens, Assistant Vice President, SUNY Miriam Taaffe, Associate Budgeting Analyst, SUNY Otto J. Teegen, State University Archietect Dr. Hermann Cooper Dr. Samuel B. Gould, President, SUNY Dr. Frank T. Lane, Acting Executive Dean, SUNY Dr. Howard Dillingham, President, Ithaca College Dr. Thomas R. Miller, President, Edinboro State College Dr. Harvey M. Rice, President, Macalester College Walter Phillips
Attached to a sample of the letter is a 3-page list of 50 names - possible recipients.
Formerly 1/35/120. Folder 1- 37. Presidents, Charles S. Turner.

Acknowledgments and thanks for Annual Report to Charles S. Turner, Acting President, SUNY Oswego. 29 letters. Correspondents include:
Frank C. Moore, Chairman, Board of Trustees, SUNY Hermann Cooper Howard Dillingham, Ithaca College John H. Slocum, Director of Indonesian Project, SUNY Thomas R. Miller, President, Edinboro State College Frank T. Lane, Acting Executive Dean, SUNY Foster S. Brown, President, St. Lawrence University Dorothy Barclay Leland F. Lyons, Vice-President, New York Life Insurance Co. Robert D. Helsby, Executive Deputy Industrial Commissioner, State of NY Dept. of Labor C. B. Murray, Executive Secretary, NYS Teachers Retirement Board Arthur S. Torrey Walter M. Wilmshurst, President, St. Lawrence County National Bank Selden T. Williams Frank A. Augsbury, Jr. Eugene G. Bewkes, Director of Education, Edward John Noble Foundation Benjamin Blackford, President, State National Bank of Connecticut G. Howard Goold, Executive Secretary, New York State Teachers Assocation Boyd E. Golder, SUNY Board of Trustees Florence Griffin Martin Mrs. Nobu Masuda (on behalf of President Hamilton), Secretary to the President, University of Hawaii Lester E. Rounds, Superintendent, Central School District No. 1, Suffern, NY Edward F. Crawford, The Assembly of the State of NY Roy G. Vilas, Cyrus J. Lawrence & Sons Walter P. Phillips Cilfton C. Flather, Dormitory Authority of the State of NY Foster S. Brown, President, St. Lawrence University Eben Griffiths Ann Kray, St. Lawrence University
Formerly 1/35/120, Folder 1-38. Presidents, Charles S. Turner.

15 typed memorandums from Charles S. Turner, Acting President, State University College, Oswego, N.Y. Recipients include the faculty, Oswego's traveling faculty, Oswego faculty on leave, Department Chairmen, and Administrative Council. Subjects include reports on status of building construction on campus, faculty promotions, events on campus and transition to Dr. James Perdue's college presidency.
Formerly 4/41/107, Memorandum, Office of President, folder 1-25.

Copies of newspaper clippings dating 1948 - 1984. Subjects include Oswego Normal School influence in Japan, college dean appointment, acting president appointment, Brazilian education project, retirement, Oswego Board of Education, Dr. Turner's obituary, and the establishment of a scholarship in his name.
Transcript of oral history notes found in Dorothy Rogers' papers. 9 pages. (50/3/31) Also, photocopies of Dr. Rogers' index cards. Dr. Rogers interviewed Donald Snygg and Charles S. Turner. No date, but premusably prior to the 1961 publication of Dr. Rogers' "Oswego: Fountainhead of Teacher Education".
Photocopy of OH 148 index (3 pages) and transcript (25 pages). Oswego County Oral History Program interview. Interviewee: Dr. Charles Turner. Interviewer: Brian M. King. February 26, 1979.

a. Group photograph. Dr. Charles S. Turner, third from left with 10 unidentified men. 1950's
b. Group photograph. Dr. Turner, standing. 2 unidentified men are seated. 1960's
c. Group photograph. Dr. Turner, standing, far right. Also published in the Syracuse Herald Journal. April 22, 1968 with the following caption: "Brazilian Educators. Seven Brazilian educational administrators who are studying elementary education curricula and preparation in the United States are pictured with their interpretors and their State University College at Oswego liaison officer, Dr. Charles S. Turner. Pictured after conferring with college administrators are, seated, interpreter Terezinha Piancastelli, Cleci Mayer, Leila M. D. Franca, Anita Martelli and Neide Xavier. Standing are Jorge E. B. C. Moraes, Father Jose Nunes, Roberto Seida, interpreter Petronio Henriquez and Dr. Turner".
d. Group photograph. Alvin M. Westcott, left. Dr. Turner, right. Unidentified man in center. 1960's
e. Group photograph. Dr. Turner, far left. Francis P. Hulme, far right. 3 unidentified individuals in center. 1960's
